channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Kentucky Tiktok suit says company considered using KY creators to sway Sen. Mitch McConnell
item.description: The suit says videos by Kentucky small businesses were identified as possibly of interest to the senator, who has expressed concern about the app's effect on kids
item.content:encoded:
The suit says videos by Kentucky small businesses were identified as possibly of interest to the senator, who has expressed concern about the app's effect on kids

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite; Matt Slocum)
item.dc:creator: Sylvia Goodman

item.title: Cuba plunged into an island wide blackout as power grid fails
item.description: Cuban government declares an "energy emergency" after the failure of one of its few power plants plunges it into an island wide blackout.
item.content:encoded:
Cuban government declares an "energy emergency" after the failure of one of its few power plants plunges it into an island wide blackout.

(Image credit: Ramon Espinosa)
item.dc:creator: Emily Green

item.title: NOAA's annual winter forecast is here. These are the weather predictions for your area
item.description: Large swaths of the South and the East Coast are favored to see warmer-than-average temperatures, while the Pacific Northwest has greater odds of cooler-than-normal conditions this winter.
item.content:encoded:
Large swaths of the South and the East Coast are favored to see warmer-than-average temperatures, while the Pacific Northwest has greater odds of cooler-than-normal conditions this winter.

(Image credit: Mark Makela)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: CVS Health CEO Lynch steps down as the drugstore chain struggles to right its path
item.description: CVS Health CEO Karen Lynch has stepped down, with company shares sinking 19% this year. CVS Health also warned of disappointing third-quarter earnings.
item.content:encoded:
CVS Health CEO Karen Lynch has stepped down, with company shares sinking 19% this year. CVS Health also warned of disappointing third-quarter earnings.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What does Yahya Sinwar's death mean for the Middle East?
item.description: What does the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar mean for the war in Gaza and the region beyond, and will it revive the chances of cease-fire and the release of the remaining hostages?
item.content:encoded:
What does the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar mean for the war in Gaza and the region beyond, and will it revive the chances of cease-fire and the release of the remaining hostages?

(Image credit: Adel Hana)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Ozempic shows promise for treating alcohol and drug abuse, study finds
item.description: The weight-loss drugs are linked with reduced rates of excess drinking and opioid overdoses, suggesting they may tamp down substance use cravings too.
item.content:encoded:
The weight-loss drugs are linked with reduced rates of excess drinking and opioid overdoses, suggesting they may tamp down substance use cravings too.

(Image credit: 5m3photos)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar is dead. Can Israel seal a hostage deal now?
item.description: The leader of Hamas, Yahya Sinwar, is dead, the Israeli military confirmed. This leaves behind very important questions about what is next for the group and whether a cease-fire deal could progress.
item.content:encoded:
The leader of Hamas, Yahya Sinwar, is dead, the Israeli military confirmed. This leaves behind very important questions about what is next for the group and whether a cease-fire deal could progress.

(Image credit: Adel Hana)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: PHOTOS: How 9 families cope when they can't afford 3 healthy meals a day for the kids
item.description: "Severe child food poverty" is on the rise, affecting 181 million young kids. Here's how families cope when their kids are hungry and they can't afford to put 3 nutritious meals a day on the table.
item.content:encoded:
"Severe child food poverty" is on the rise, affecting 181 million young kids. Here's how families cope when their kids are hungry and they can't afford to put 3 nutritious meals a day on the table.

(Image credit: Sope Adelaja for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Emily Sohn

item.title: Mortgage rates were supposed to come down. Instead, they're rising. Here's why
item.description: Mortgage rates are ticking up, even after the Federal Reserve has started cutting interest rates. Here's why, and where rates — and home sales — could go from here.
item.content:encoded:
Mortgage rates are ticking up, even after the Federal Reserve has started cutting interest rates. Here's why, and where rates — and home sales — could go from here.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley

item.title: Former Canadian Olympian is accused of being a fugitive drug lord
item.description: Ryan Wedding was once an Olympic snowboarder. But now he faces federal charges of operating a sprawling cocaine trafficking ring — and ordering several murders.
item.content:encoded:
Ryan Wedding was once an Olympic snowboarder. But now he faces federal charges of operating a sprawling cocaine trafficking ring — and ordering several murders.

(Image credit: Adam Pretty)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell
